slider.title: Welcome to SoundCollect, we have heard you get here!
slider.desc: Connect to your environment through your ear and make citizen science to discover tranquility!

slider2.title: Let’s start this sound journey around Catalonia!
slider2.desc: Identify, evaluate and share quiet acoustic areas

slider3.desc: Describe quantitatively and qualitatively the sound elements around you, intuitively, easily and quickly.

slider4.desc: Get around the interactive map to discover quiet areas and explore the acoustic identity of every corner.

slider5.desc: Share your sound experiences from the spaces you visit. Join the SoundCollect community. Your participation is key to understanding and preserving quiet areas.

process.sharpness_S_descrip:
is a psychoacoustic parameter that compares the high
frequency energy content of an acoustic signal with its total energy.
Sharpness is caused by high frequency noises (high pitched), and it may
cause pain sensation to humans.
process.loudness_N_descrip:
is a subjective measurament of the intensity at which a
noise is perceived by human audition. This parameter is frequency
dependent and, as a consequence, two acoustic events with the same
sound level but different frequency not necessarily will result in the same
sensation of volume in human ear.
process.roughtness_R_descrip:
is a parameter that quantifies the subjective
perception of the fast modulation (15-300Hz) of a sound’s amplitude. The
auditive sensation represented by roughness, which often produces
annoyance for the human ear, is related to sound modulation at
frequencies too high to be discerned separately (modulation frequencies
larger than 30 Hz).
process.fluctuation_strength_F_descrip:
is a parameter that quantifies the subjective
perception to slow amplitude modulations (up to 20Hz). Therefore, it is a
similar concept to roughness, but at lower modulation frequencies.
Fluctuation strength persists up to 20 Hz approximately, point at which a
complex region for fluctuation strength and roughness evaluation starts.
This region extends up to 30 Hz approximately, where the subjective
perception starts to be dominated by roughness alone.
process.spectral: Graphic of spectral levels in ⅓ octave.

answers.Q1A2: Human beings: Conversation, laughter, children at play, footsteps.
answers.Q1A3: Traffic noise: car, buses, trains, air planes.
answers.Q1A4: Other sounds: sirens, construction, industry, loading of goods.

parameters.title: Acoustic parameters
parameters.info:
Leq (o LAeq) stands for the equivalent continuous sound pressure level. This term refers to a constant noise level that, over a specific period, would generate the same total sound energy as the actual varying noise levels.


The terminology “LA” refers to the A-weighted sound pressure level. A-weighting in acoustics adjusts sound measurements to match human hearing sensitivity, giving more weight to mid-range frequencies and less to low and high frequencies. These adjusted levels noted as dB(A) or dBA, are used to better represent sound impact on people.


The parameter LAeq,t is a type of average of the “Equivalent continuous sound level” over the sample period (t). It represents the sound level measured in a specific time interval. In the case of SoundCollect, the interval is 1 second. Therefore, LAeq,t shows the evolution of the recorded sound every second and the application records the sound for 30 seconds, a total of LAeq,t=30s values are obtained.


From the LAeq value, the other acoustic parameters shown on the screen are calculated:


  • LAmax: This is the maximum sound pressure level value recorded over 30 seconds.
  • LAmin: This is the minimum sound pressure level value recorded over 30 seconds.
  • L10: This is the sound pressure level exceeded 10% of the time.
  • L90: This is the sound pressure level exceeded 90% of the time.

For instance, if L90=60dB, it means that during 27 seconds (90%) of a 30-second recording, the sound pressure level was above 60dB. On the other hand, if L10=70dB, it indicates that during 3 seconds (10%) of the same 30-second recording, the sound pressure level exceeded 70dB.

terms_and_conditions.title: Terms and Conditions
terms_and_conditions.description:
Welcome to the terms and conditions that regulate your use of SoundCollect and its software, applications, services and technologies. Please read the terms and conditions carefully.


Purpose

SoundCollect offers users an application for smartphones, so that users can report information on community spaces of high acoustic and socio-environmental value, in order to create a collaborative map of quiet areas at a local level that allows to improve the management, protection and conservation of these spaces.


The service

The service includes all the functions and software we provide to create an application driven by users in order to generate an interactive map that will allow you to discover places and inform about their status through the tools offered by SoundCollect, including the possibility of attaching images and sounds.

You can only use the service:

  • If you accept the terms and conditions and the privacy policy
  • If you have the legal age to give consent for your data to be processed, or if you provide a sworn statement that your parents or legal guardians have consented to the use of the service.

Use the service responsibly.

Please always take care of your environment and never endanger yourself while using SoundCollect. Never register data under insecure conditions. Always take into account your safety first and foremost. The use of SoundCollect is carried out under your own responsibility.


Your user account

With our service aims to help identify public spaces of high acoustic and socio-environmental value, to promote their democratisation, knowledge, maintenance and preservation, in a collective, responsible and ecological way. In other words, this service allows to generate knowledge about the environmental value of surrounding spaces and, ultimately, influence policy makers to take measures to recover them, and preserve them in a sustainable and inclusive way.

A user account is necessary for the use of the platform. A minimum amount of personal data is required for registration, in particular, a pseudonym and an active email are required. The rest of the data requested are optional. All personal data are processed in a lawful manner and respecting European data protection regulations, all as detailed in our privacy policy.

By registering and accepting the terms of use, you are granting us permission to process your personal data. It is also accepting the treatment by external services, such as servers, cloud hosting providers, integrated services and other components necessary for the use of SoundCollect.


Unregistered SoundCollect Usage

You can always view SoundCollect content without registering or logging in to navigate. However, if you want to actively participate and register, you must create your own user account or log in to be part of our community.


Geo-spatial constraints

You declare that you will not share information that conflicts with the ownership or privacy of others or that is obtained in restricted areas. By providing and locating data on a public space, you assume full and complete legal responsibility for your contribution. You confirm that it is legal, according to local laws, to create and share data on this site, and that no third party will be limited or damaged, or that the value of any third party property will be diminished by your contribution.


Violation of terms of use

We respect copyright and intellectual property rights, third-party privacy, trademarks and license rights.

We reserve the unrestricted right to remove any content that has been contributed in violation of these terms, the terms of the license or any applicable regulation.


GDPR and our team

Some personal data is required to use the SoundCollect application. All personal data are regulated by the General Data Protection Regulation (EU) 2016/679 (GRPD). You can erase all your personal data from the entire project platform at any time. You can also download all the data you have provided to the project. Participation in this project is completely voluntary.

Our team is informed about the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and its obligations. We continually train our team in terms of data protection, personal rights, copyright, trademark and license rights and aspects of digital privacy, in particular also on a data protection ethics experienced in a modern and connected world.


Ethical considerations

It is not allowed to use the application in an unethical way, that is, you cannot load false data in bad faith, nor upload images or audios that allow to identify third parties, that is, they can be considered as personal data of third parties (in any case, false data, or personal data of third parties are identified during the process of data validation and are not loaded on the public map if they are detected).

What will be the benefits or risks of participating in SoundCollect?

Anyone of legal age can participate in this citizen science initiative. There are no economic incentives associated with their participation in the project. Our objective is to generate data on public spaces of acoustic and socio-environmental value, which can be used by different actors to create solutions to the problems of their use and conservation. However, this is a collaborative research project that has no direct relationship with any type of actors involved in the decisions that may affect the administration and management of such spaces.

Is there any direct connection between this collaborative research project and the government action?

There is no direct connection between this research project and government action, or any other action that may be undertaken by activities that cause noise pollution.

How can I leave the project?

You are free to leave the project at any time. All personal data are regulated by the GRPD, so you can exercise your rights in accordance with this law. The SoundCollect application provides an interface to erase all your personal data, although by default, observation data and other non-personal data you have uploaded to the platform will be maintained. However, you can request its complete deletion by email at hello·soundcollect.eu

privacy_policy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy_policy.description:
Are you willing to participate in SoundCollect, a citizen science project based on the direct involvement of citizens, policymakers, scientists, industries and SMEs that aims to identify and protect community spaces? With your help we seek to recognize and make visible places of acoustic and socio-environmental value in order to promote their knowledge, care and preservation.


For us, it is essential that you understand what personal data we are collecting and how we will process this information. We care about your personal data and your rights over them. Your data will be processed in a lawful manner, subject at all times to the principles and rights enshrined in the General Data Protection Regulation (EU Directive 2016/679), the LOPDGDD 3/2018 and all other relevant regulations on the protection of personal data.


Please read this information carefully. If you have any questions or something is not clear to you, write to us at hello@soundcollect.eu.


Responsible for processing


Identity: SCIENCE FOR CHANGE
C.I.F: B67362392
Home: C/ Vilamarí, no. 50, 7o, 08015, Barcelona, Spain
Email address: hello@soundcollect.eu.
Web: www.scienceforchange.eu
Telephone: 932 43 33 10


Personal data processed


We collect different types of data. For the use of SoundCollect we will request the following Personal Data:
- Email
- Pseudonym / name
- Geolocation
- Date and time of your registration.
- Optional: Year of birth and gender.


Purpose of the processing of personal data


We process your personal data in order to allow the operation of SoundCollect. The purpose of the platform is to identify public spaces with a high socio-environmental value to generate an interactive map from them. This map seeks to democratize public spaces, allowing citizens to know them, value them, take care of them and preserve them. On the other hand, the processing of your data aims to keep you informed about the new developments of the project, its benefits and advances.


The processing of your personal data is necessary for the creation of your user account and so that you can use all the functionalities of SoundCollect. That is, so you can record the location of a site, load images that allow other users to view it, and load sounds to help the community understand the sound atmosphere of the site. We will also use your email, if you authorize us for this purpose, to send you information about specific events or about results related to the project.


Information about your year of birth and gender will be used exclusively for statistical, scientific purposes and for the general interest.


On the other hand, we process your geolocation data with the aim that you can report the location of a public place of socio-environmental value for the elaboration of a collective and interactive map.


Legitimation of treatment


The basis for legitimizing the processing of data is the consent granted by the user by selecting the acceptance box of our privacy policy and the SoundCollect information and communications box. The user has the right to revoke their consent at any time without affecting the legality of the treatment based on the consent prior to its withdrawal.


Transfer or communication of personal data and international transfers


Your data will not be communicated or transferred to third parties, unless there is a legal obligation or those providers linked to the Responsible who act as data processors. No international transfers are made, in the event that at any time they may be made, they will be communicated to you in order to obtain your consent.


Retention period


These data will be kept for the time strictly necessary to fulfill the purpose for which they were collected and, only as long as the user does not revoke his consent to the processing of them.


Your rights and how to exercise them


<> The user can exercise all the rights recognized by the RGPD 2016/679 and other current regulations regarding data protection. In particular, you have the following rights:
- Request information about the personal data we have about you and, if so, what information we have, why we have it and how we are using it.
- Request access to your personal data. This allows you to receive a copy of your personal data and correct any incomplete or incorrect information we have about them.
- Request the limitation of the processing of your data
- Oppose the processing of the same by withdrawing your consent.
- Solicitar la rectificación o eliminación de tus datos personales. Esto te permite borrar o pedirnos que borremos sus datos personales.
- Request the rectification or erasure of your personal data. This allows you to delete or ask us to delete your personal data.
- Request the transfer of your personal data to you or to a third party in an electronic and structured format - commonly known as the right to data portability.


You can exercise your rights by contacting the following email box: hello@scienceforchange.eu. If you consider that your rights have not been duly respected, you have the right to file a claim with the Spanish Data Protection Agency.


Processing of data of minors


Whoever provides the data through the forms of this website and accepts its treatment declares to be over 14 years old, being prohibited the access and use of the portal to minors of this age. If, at any time, the Responsible detects that a person under 14 years of age has provided personal data, we will proceed to cancel them. Likewise, parents or guardians may in any case contact SCIENCE FOR CHANGE to block the access account of minors under their care who have registered by falsifying their identity.


Security measures


In SCIENCE FOR CHANGE we treat your data in a lawful way and in compliance with current regulations on data protection. To this end, we have implemented technical and organizational security measures to guarantee the security of the user’s personal data and to prevent its alteration, loss, treatment and unauthorized access, as well as to avoid any other unauthorized risk to which they may be exposed.


The measures include, among others, the safeguarding of the confidentiality, integrity and availability of the data through the control of physical and electronic access to them, as well as the access, introduction, transmission, insurance and separation of the data. In addition, we have established procedures to ensure that the rights of data subjects are respected, that data is erased and that we are prepared to respond quickly to data threats. In addition, we take into account the protection of personal data from the development or selection of hardware, software and service providers, in accordance with the privacy principle from the design and privacy by default.


To protect your data transmitted through our online services in the best possible way, we use encryption, anonymization and pseudonymitication techniques, among others

no_user_auth.text: To view the content, you need to log in or create an account.

calibration.popupTxt: A proper calibration of the mobile devices ensures that the data obtained is reliable and precise. Over time, factors such as weather, frequent use or environmental changes may cause deviations with respect to the correct values.For this reason, calibrating the mobile devices ensures a reduction of measurement errors by correcting these deviations.
calibration.beginCalibrationTxt1: Record 10 seconds with the device and the sonometer simultaneously in a quiet room.
calibration.beginCalibrationTxt2: Install the external microphone to the device, then attach the pistonphone calibrator to the external microphone. Record 10 seconds.
calibration.beginCalibrationTxt3: Record 10 seconds simultaneously with your devices and with the calibrated device in a quiet room.
calibration.beginCalibrationTxt4: Record 10 seconds with your device in a quiet room.
calibration.doneValidationTxt: You can now continue recording audio as usual.
calibration.calibration_value_desc: This is the obtained calibration value:
calibration.calibration_value_desc2: Do you know the real value?
calibration.calibration_value_desc3: The range should be between 20 and 140 dB.
calibration.calibration_value_desc4: Yes, I can measure it manually
calibration.select_reference_text: Select whether or not you have a device to use as a reference:
calibration.sound_level_meter: I have a sound level meter
calibration.sound_level_meter_txt: A sonometer is a measurement device that is used to measure the sound level with an accurate microphone.
calibration.external_microphone_txt: An external microphone is a microphone that is connected to the mobile device and can provide more accurate measurements than the internal microphone.
calibration.another_device_txt: A calibrated mobile device is another mobile device, different from the user's own, that has been previously calibrated and provides reliable results.
calibration.no_reference_txt: The users can select this option if they do not have access to a sonometer, an exterior microphone or a calibrated device. This option performs a check of the values being measured by the application.
calibration.calibration_device_1: Enter the sound pressure level (dBA) value obtained with the sound level meter.
calibration.calibration_device_2: Introduce the value of 94 dB to the device.
calibration.calibration_device_3: Enter the sound pressure level (dBA) value obtained from the calibrated device.
calibration.calibration_device_4: If the measured value is in the range of 25-35 dBA, the device is considered as calibrated. If it is outside the indicated range, the reference value automatically considered by the application is 30 dBA.
calibration.notification_description: Calibration is out of correct range. Go to a quiet room and press Recalibrate. The range is 25-35 but the value received is
